data.text: Draghi: A TLTRO is an operation that allows banks to borrow from the ECB at somewhat more favourable terms than in the market. If there were no subsidies nobody would take up the TLTRO.

Draghi: It's easy for us to plea for more action on a European levels, but these are political decisions that governments have to take and they have to explain to their citizens; it is much more difficult to implement them in a democratic society
Draghi: In a dark room you move with tiny steps. You don’t run but you do move.
Draghi: Several members of Governing Council proposed extending the calendar of forward guidance to March next year
Draghi: Our actions increased the resilience of the euro area economy and keep us confident that convergence of inflation towards our objective will happen
Draghi: This is a positive sign for cohesiveness of Governing Council and our deliberations
Draghi: Today's decisions were unanimous
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/46l76Iz4fw

Draghi: Improving the functioning of Economic and Monetary Union remains a priority. The Governing Council welcomes the ongoing work and urges further specific and decisive steps to complete the banking union and the capital markets union.

Draghi: The implementation of structural reforms in euro area countries needs to be substantially stepped up to increase resilience, reduce structural unemployment and boost euro area productivity and growth potential
Draghi: The policy measures decided today, and in particular the new series of TLTROs, will help to ensure that bank lending conditions remain favourable
Draghi introduces the GDP and inflation outlook for the euro area https://t.co/8C5lxUR9NU

Draghi: Compared with the December 2018 Eurosystem staff macroeconomic projections, the outlook for HICP inflation has been revised down across the projection horizon, reflecting in particular the more subdued near-term growth outlook

Draghi: The risks surrounding the euro area growth outlook are still tilted to the downside, on account of the persistence of uncertainties related to geopolitical factors, the threat of protectionism and vulnerabilities in emerging markets

Draghi: Euro area expansion will continue to be supported by favourable financing conditions, further employment gains and rising wages, and the ongoing – albeit somewhat slower – expansion in global activity

Draghi: In any event, the Governing Council stands ready to adjust all of its instruments, as appropriate, to ensure that inflation continues to move towards the Governing Council’s inflation aim in a sustained manner
Draghi: Today’s decisions will support the further build-up of domestic price pressures and headline inflation developments over the medium term
Draghi: Underlying inflation continues to be muted. The weaker economic momentum is slowing the adjustment of inflation towards our aim.
Draghi: The persistence of uncertainties related to geopolitical factors, the threat of protectionism and vulnerabilities in emerging markets appears to be leaving marks on economic sentiment

Draghi: While there are signs that some of the idiosyncratic domestic factors dampening growth are starting to fade, the weakening in economic data points to a sizeable moderation in the pace of the economic expansion that will extend into the current year

Draghi: Like the outstanding TLTRO programme, TLTRO-III will feature built-in incentives for credit conditions to remain favourable. Further details on the precise terms of TLTRO-III will be communicated in due course.

Draghi: Under TLTRO-III, counterparties will be entitled to borrow up to 30% of the stock of eligible loans as at 28 February 2019 at a rate indexed to the interest rate on the main refinancing operations over the life of each operation
Draghi: These new TLTRO-III operations will help to preserve favourable bank lending conditions and the smooth transmission of monetary policy
Draghi: We decided to launch a new series of quarterly targeted longer-term refinancing operations (TLTRO-III), starting in September 2019 and ending in March 2021, each with a maturity of two years

Draghi: We intend to continue reinvesting, in full, the principal payments from maturing securities purchased under the APP for an extended period of time past the date when we start raising the key ECB interest rates, and in any case for as long as necessary

Draghi: We now expect the key interest rates to remain at their present levels at least through the end of 2019, and in any case for as long as necessary to ensure the continued sustained convergence of inflation to our objective

L’UE ha molti canali tramite cui gli Europei esercitano il controllo democratico. Poiché le istituzioni europee hanno ricevuto poteri precisi, il nesso tra decisioni e responsabilità è diretto, il controllo democratico è chiaro. Leggi il discorso integrale https://t.co/hYHJ7YVvmW

In un mondo globalizzato, i paesi per essere sovrani devono cooperare. Leggi il discorso del Presidente Draghi su come l’appartenenza all’UE aiuta gli Stati a essere sovrani proteggendoli da pressioni esterne e rendendo più efficaci le politiche interne https://t.co/hYHJ7YVvmW https://t.co/uj6Z37ax3h

The EU has many channels through which Europeans can exercise democratic control. Because European institutions have defined powers, citizens can hold them accountable against their mandate. Read full speech https://t.co/SbQjFgzfdQ

EU membership enables countries’ policy choices by giving them the possibility to achieve goals they could not realise alone and to ensure that globalisation is not a race to the bottom on standards https://t.co/SbQjFgzfdQ

EU membership protects countries from external pressures as our common structures and institutions contain spillovers, ensure a level playing field and prevent unjust behaviour https://t.co/SbQjFgzfdQ

Benoît Cœuré: The journey towards a true European safe asset will be long and full of perils. We should thus focus our efforts on improving credit quality, which can only be achieved if governments make public debt more sustainable by committing to credible fiscal rules.

Benoît Cœuré: The supply of euro-denominated safe assets can shrink at precisely the time when demand for such assets is rising. This is likely a dominant factor keeping the euro from having a stronger international role. Find out more https://t.co/PztAmrGlAD
Benoît Cœuré: A stronger global role for the euro may have tangible consequences for the conduct of monetary policy. Read more https://t.co/PztAmrGlAD

Benoît Cœuré: The ECB continues to see the global role of the euro as being primarily a market-led process. Nevertheless, we support efforts to overcome the shortcomings of the monetary union, and these efforts will also indirectly strengthen the international role of the euro.

Executive Board member Benoît Cœuré reflects on the international role of the euro 20 years after its launch and what this development means for monetary policy. Full speech https://t.co/PztAmrGlAD https://t.co/8cSYZvx7WA
